Package eu.df.jiffybox.modules

Interface ModuleBackups

public interface ModuleBackups
This interface describes the backups module.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static ModuleBackups build​(java.lang.String baseUrl)
    Build the module.
    Response<java.lang.Boolean> createManualBackup​(int id)
    Each JiffyBox is able to hold exactly one manual backup.
    Response<BackupConfig> createPeriodicalBackups​(int id, int dayid, int timeid)
    Using this command you are able to set if periodical backups shall be created.
    Response<java.lang.Boolean> deleteBackup​(int id, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String backupid)
    With this command it is possible to delete a backup using its type (manual, daily, weekly, biweekly) and its unique ID.
    Response<java.lang.Boolean> deletePeriodicalBackups​(int id)
    By default automated backups of every JiffyBox are created on a daily basis.
    Response<Backup> getBackup​(int id)
    This method provides details about every backup of a given JiffyBox.
    Response<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Backup>> getBackups()
    You may use this command to display the backups of each JiffyBox but it is significantly slower than the selective querying a single JiffyBox, because the backup servers check the backups availability in a synchronous manner.
    Response<java.lang.Boolean> restoreBackup​(int id, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String backupid)
    With this command it is possible to replace the content of a given JiffyBox with a given backup.
    Response<BackupConfig> updatePeriodicalBackups​(int id, int dayid, int timeid)
    Using this command you are able to change an existing backup configuration.

  • Method Details

    • build

      static ModuleBackups build​(java.lang.String baseUrl)
      Build the module.
      Parameters:
      baseUrl - the base URL
      Returns:
      the module

    • getBackups

      Response<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Backup>> getBackups()
      You may use this command to display the backups of each JiffyBox but it is significantly slower than the selective querying a single JiffyBox, because the backup servers check the backups availability in a synchronous manner. Whenever possible you should stick with the specific query.
      Returns:
      The retrieved Backups.

    • getBackup

      Response<Backup> getBackup​(int id)
      This method provides details about every backup of a given JiffyBox. Since this call acts in a synchronous manner it may take longer than typical on-load. The availability of the backups is checked directly on the backup storages, therefore only finished backups will be displayed. The return values day and time show, if and when the automated daily backup will be scheduled. If there are no return values automated backups are deactivated. day is a value between 0 (Sunday) and 6 (Saturday). time is either 0 (between 12:00 a.m and 4:00 a.m), 1 (between 4:00 a.m and 6:00 a.m) or 6 (between 10:00 p.m and 12:00 a.m).
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      Returns:
      The retrieved Backup.

    • createPeriodicalBackups

      Response<BackupConfig> createPeriodicalBackups​(int id, int dayid, int timeid)
      Using this command you are able to set if periodical backups shall be created.
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      dayid - The day of week the backup should be done. Possible values are 0 (on Sunday) to 6 (on Saturday).
      timeid - The time frame, when the backup should be created. Possible values are: 1 (between 12:00 a.m and 4:00 a.m, 2 (between 4:00 a.m and 6:00 a.m) and 6 (between 10:00 p.m and 12:00 a.m)
      Returns:
      The created BackupConfig.

    • updatePeriodicalBackups

      Response<BackupConfig> updatePeriodicalBackups​(int id, int dayid, int timeid)
      Using this command you are able to change an existing backup configuration. To create a new one or activate automated backups use the POST verb. The arguments are the same as in the POST method. The only exception is, that all arguments are optional and only given values will be changed. Use null for values you don't want to change.
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      dayid - The day of week the backup should be done. Possible values are 0 (on Sunday) to 6 (on Saturday).
      timeid - The time frame, when the backup should be created. Possible values are: 1 (between 12:00 a.m and 4:00 a.m, 2 (between 4:00 a.m and 6:00 a.m) and 6 (between 10:00 p.m and 12:00 a.m)
      Returns:
      The updated BackupConfig.

    • deletePeriodicalBackups

      Response<java.lang.Boolean> deletePeriodicalBackups​(int id)
      By default automated backups of every JiffyBox are created on a daily basis. If this is undesired (e. g. on-load) you may deactivate automated backups. Please notice, that deactivating automated backups will cause old automated backups to disappear. However this call does not affect manual backups or the possibility to create those.
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      Returns:
      If the deletion of the BackupConfig has successfully been initiated.

    • createManualBackup

      Response<java.lang.Boolean> createManualBackup​(int id)
      Each JiffyBox is able to hold exactly one manual backup. This method may be used to request a manual backup. The process itself is completely asynchronous. A success (result TRUE) only means, that the manual backup was requested successfully. However it does not mean it was finished or even started. If a manual backup is running, can be evaluated using ModuleJiffyBoxes. There is a flag manualBackupRunning which is set to TRUE in case the backup is running. As soon as the backup is finished it is displayed within the backup overview.
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      Returns:
      If the manual backup has been successfully initiated.

    • deleteBackup

      Response<java.lang.Boolean> deleteBackup​(int id, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String backupid)
      With this command it is possible to delete a backup using its type (manual, daily, weekly, biweekly) and its unique ID. Type and ID may be obtained using the according GET commands.
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      type - Type
      backupid - Backup-ID
      Returns:
      If the deletion of the backup has been successfully initiated.

    • restoreBackup

      Response<java.lang.Boolean> restoreBackup​(int id, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String backupid)
      With this command it is possible to replace the content of a given JiffyBox with a given backup. All data is lost and configurations (profiles, hard drives) are reset to the backups state during this process. A list of valid backup types and IDs can be obtained using get(int id) on this module.
      Parameters:
      id - Box-ID
      type - Type
      backupid - Backup-ID
      Returns:
      If the process of restoring the backup has been successfully initiated.
